# contentEditingOutput

**Instance Property**

The output of an asset content editing session.

## Declaration

```swift
var contentEditingOutput: PHContentEditingOutput? { get set }
```

## Discussion

To edit an asset’s image or video content, you must first begin a content editing session with the asset’s [doc://com.apple.photokit/documentation/Photos/PHAsset/requestContentEditingInput(with:completionHandler:)] method. You commit a content edit by setting the [doc://com.apple.photokit/documentation/Photos/PHAssetChangeRequest/contentEditingOutput] property of a change request within a change block. For more information about asset content editing, see [doc://com.apple.photokit/documentation/Photos/PHAsset].

## Editing Asset Content

- **revertAssetContentToOriginal()**: Request to revert any edits made to the asset’s content.
